explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 1 because of its flash point: -45degC, boiling point: 34.6degC (ICSC, 2004) and UNRTDG No. 2363, Class: 3, PGI

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG Class: 3

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gas substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: The lower one is adopted among 1215-2450 mg/kg (DFGOT vol.13 (1999)) in rats and 1207 to 1704 mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2005)). It was set as Category 4 based on LD50= 1207mg/kg.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on LD50 = 45625ppm, which is converted value for 4 hours of LC50 for 150 minute rat test = 73000ppm(DFGOT vol.13 (1999)), it was classified as out of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Any inhalation study is done at the concentration lower than the saturated vapor pressure pressures concentration, and there is no data of mists.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is a result of having no skin stimulativeness in rabbit test (DFGOT vol.13 (1999)). However, on the other hand, there is also a description of mild irritativeness in a rabbit test (RTECS (2005)). Although severe irritation is reported for guinea pig test (RTECS (2005)), it was 24 hour exposuretest, and it was regarded as a reference. Based on two examinations on rabbits and EU R phrase: Xn; R66, it was classified as Category 3.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2B based on the mild reversible stimulus being indicated by two examinations of a rabbit (DFGOT vol.13 (1999)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: No data Skin sensitization: Although skin sensitization was not identified by the examinationof the guinea pigs(DFGOT vol.13 (1999)), since there is a statement that the reliability of this examination is questionable, it was decided that it could not beclassified due to the insufficiency of data.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: It gave negative in the in vitro mutagenicity test (the reverse mutation test using bacteria, the chromosomal aberration test using the mammalian cultured cells) (DFGOT vol.13 (1999)), however, we found no in vivo test data. Therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it by the technical guideline.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since although maternal toxicity is not indicated, fetal absorption was observed in rats (IUCLID (2005)), embryonic cleft palates increased (DFGOT vol.13 (1999)), fetal head length decreased in mice (DFGOT vol.13 (1999)), and abnormalities of fetal figure, internal organs and sccafold were observed in rats and mice(DFGOT vol.13 (1999)), it was classified into Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is no description about toxic symptom in animal test. There is the respiratory irritation in the case of using it as anesthetics to human (DFGOT vol.13 (1999), PATTY (5th, 2005), IUCLID (2005)). So it is classified into Category 3 (anesthetic action, respiratory irritation).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Toxicity is not discovered to specific organs with the concentration of all exceeded the guidance value of Category 2 in test using rats (IRIS (2005), DFGOT vol.13 (1999)). Although in humans some neurological symptoms were discovered, since it was concluded that all were transient, it carried out the outside of Category.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be harmful if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Category 2 because of "possible to be classified into Aspiration hazard (ICSC)"

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 48-hour LC50=1378.63mg/L of Crustacea(Daphnia magna) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =60400 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.
